TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContentDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for the Web server control.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActionLists As DesignerActionListCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the object for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner> objects add <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> elements to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml (regions As DesignerRegionCollection) As String

Docs.param: The associated with the design-time markup generated by .
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to represent the control at design time from the specified object.
Docs.returns: The markup that is used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The markup generated by <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> includes region identifiers. <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> should add <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> elements to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> specified by the `regions` parameter.

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetEditableDesignerRegionContent (region As EditableDesignerRegion) As String

Docs.param: The from which to get the content.
Docs.summary: Gets the content of the specified object.
Docs.returns: The persistence string for the content of the specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> elements are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> and the design-time markup contains region identifiers, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method is used to return the content for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection>

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetPersistenceContent() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetPersistenceContent () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the inner markup of the control.
Docs.returns: The inner markup of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A region is not a property of the control, so for persistent content, this method must return the inner HTML markup of the control.

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PostFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub PostFilterProperties (properties As IDictionary)

Docs.param: The objects that represent the properties of the class of the component. The keys in the dictionary of properties are property names.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of properties that it exposes through a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method provides a way to change or remove items within the dictionary of properties that are exposed through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.
In this overridden method, the designer clears all properties except <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.ContentPlaceHolderID%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ID%2A>.

block.para: You can directly filter the dictionary that is accessible through the parameter, or you can leave it unchanged. If you are overriding this method, call the base implementation after you perform your own filtering.

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterEvents(class System.Collections.IDictionary events) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub PreFilterEvents (events As IDictionary)

Docs.param: The objects that represent the events of the class of the component. The keys in the dictionary of events are event names.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of events that it exposes through a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method provides a way to add items to the dictionary of events that a designer exposes through a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>.
The keys in the dictionary of events are the names of the events. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor>.
In this overridden method, the designer clears all events for this control.

block.para: You can directly modify the dictionary that is accessible through the parameter, or you can leave it unchanged. If you are overriding this method, call the base implementation before you perform your own filtering.

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (region As EditableDesignerRegion, content As String)
public: override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(System::Web::UI::Design::EditableDesignerRegion ^ region, System::String ^ content);

Docs.param: The in which to set the content.
The persistence string for the content.
Docs.summary: Sets the content of the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Developers will typically persist the content to the control or property that represents the region.
If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> elements are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection> and the design-time markup contains region identifiers, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ContentDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method is used to set the content for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection>.

Docs.related: Introduction to ASP.NET Control Designers
Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
